text: Human T-cell leukemia virus type I <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> associates with and is negatively regulated by the <extra_id_0> NF-kappa B2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> p100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene product : implications for viral latency .

Human T-cell leukemia virus type I ( HTLV-I ) is the etiologic agent of the adult T-cell leukemia , an aggressive and often fatal malignancy of activated human <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> T cells .

HTLV-I encodes an essential 40-kDa protein termed <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that not only transactivates the long terminal repeat of this retrovirus but also induces an array of cellular genes .

<extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transformation of T cells likely involves the deregulated expression of various cellular genes that normally regulate lymphocyte growth produced by altered activity of various endogenous host transcription factors .

In particular , <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is capable of modulating the expression or activity of various host transcription factors , including members of the NF-kappa B / Rel and CREB / ATF families , as well as the cellular factors HEB-1 and <extra_id_0> p67SRF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
An additional distinguishing characteristic of HTLV-I infection is the profound state of viral latency that is present in circulating primary leukemic T cells .

In this study , we demonstrate that HTLV-I <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can physically associate with <extra_id_0> p100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the product of the Rel-related <extra_id_0> NF-kappa B2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , both in transfected cells and in HTLV-I-infected leukemic T-cell lines .

Furthermore , the physical interaction of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with <extra_id_0> p100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> leads to the inhibition of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced activation of the HTLV-I and human immunodeficiency virus type 1 long terminal repeats , reflecting <extra_id_0> p100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated cytoplasmic sequestration of the normally nuclearly expressed <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein .

In contrast , a mutant of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that selectively fails to activate nuclear NF-kappa B expression does not associate with <extra_id_0> p100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
